Lost civilizations are usually what people learn in history about. Archaeology unlocks secrets of the past. The ancient Inca of Peru had no formal alphabet or system of writing. They did not leave archives for historians to study. The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. The first Europeans to meet the Inca were amazed that they could run a huge empire using strings to keep records. Archaeologists have found many ancient quipus but today no one knows what the knots mean. Without anyone who can read the stories tied into the colorful strings, understanding ther Anicent Inca is alot like soloving a mystery. So how do we know about a civilization that for nearly a hundred years ruled a South American empire that rivaled the exspanse of ancient Rome? Clues left behind by the Inca form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, argriculture,goverment,transportation,and the way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca Life. Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history,or stories passed from generation to generation. Passing on the stories was an important way to preserve a community's history. We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. The visitors were Spanish soldiers and preists. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. Historians have to be careful when they interpret these accounts. The Spaniards did not speak the Inca language well. They may not have understood what the Inca told them, so their descriptions might not be accurate. And some of the Inca stories were legends rather than history. The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from the sites where artifacts are found. As in many ancient civilizations,Inca artifacts might be objects made from stone,pottery,gold, or silver. Such materials last a long time, even if they have been buried for hundereds of years. Some artifacts turn up in the ruins of buildings. Others are found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Ancient materials like cloth are usually destroyed by dampness,but these have been Peru's coasts or the cold mountains of the Andes. Some Inca sites have been disturbed by treasure hunters or looters, who take anything that might be valuable. Some treasures were taken centuries ago, but looting still goes on today. Looted sites often do not tell archaeologists very much. Other sites are reported to Archaeologists, who can dig them up ccarefully. They provide the bestidea of all about life in Peru before and during Inca rule. Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down Photograph any artifacts they find, and note the exact positionin which they find them. They need too learn as much information as they can from every single piece of evidence. Archaeologists can compare what they learn from artifacts and sites with the Spaniards accounts of the Inca. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record. Amoung the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happen too it. The fall of the Inca is easyto date because the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the empire. The orgins of the Inca are more difficult to trace. The area where they lived had been inhabited by diffrent people's. Archaeologists use some of the most advanced techniques in the world too discover more about the Inca's predecessors. You'll see how aerial photogrtrapghy can help them find patterns in ancient monuments that they connot see from the ground. The Inca lived high in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountain peaks. Many of their sites are in remote, high places. Some Inca were buried in caves in cliff faces, for example, or on mountain tops. This has helped too preserve the sites, because looters cannot easily get to them. But it also makes the job of the archaeologist more difficult. High-altitude archaeologists are expert mountaineers. They have to carry all their equiment up a mountain for study. The cold mountains act like a giant freezer. Bodies found in the icy Andes are in such good shape that experts can use modern medical scanning equitment to learn about how the people died. The bodies also reveal information about how they lived .

Lost Civilizations                                 There have been many ancient civilizations that have dispersed or have been lost in modern society. In this article there will be information about three different lost civilizations, the ancient Inca tribe, the ancestral Puebloans, and the lost city of Atlantis. They were all once great communities, but they all were lost.               The Inca were once very powerful, they, at one time, controlled most of South America. The Inca tribe had no real way of writing, there was nothing left behind for the archaeologists to study. There was a colored knot system that kept record of the calender to keep count of the animals. There have been archaeologists that have found this ancient knots, but have never been able to understand what the knots mean. Since nobody can read the stories left in the colorful strings, figuring out the way that the Incas lived is much like solving a mystery with no clues. There are still clues left behind by them, like portraits of their religion, art, and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. Using these clues many archaeologist are able to interpret what some of their daily life routines were like. Some things that historians know comes from oral history, and stories that had been passed down from generation to generation. Europeans, who had arrived in 1532, had written some of the stories down and had described the Inca in letters an diaries. It is hard for historians to really know what to understand, because the Europeans did not understand the European language well. Their descriptions of them probably would not be accurate either. Everything else the archaeologist know comes from the artifacts that they find in excavations. Many of the artifacts are mad out of stone, pottery, gold, or silver, and many of them are found in ruin of the building, or in a grave for the dead to use in the afterlife. There are som sites that do not help the archaeologists, because of looter, or treasure hunters, that had gotten the artifacts first. But many other sites are first found by the historians who find artifacts and may be take to different museums. The historians can differentiate the differences between the artifacts and the Spainards descriptions of them.               A long time before the Europeans explored North America, there was a group of people living in the Four Corners region, who chose Mesa Verde as their new home. For over 700 years generations lived and made their lives there. But in the late 1200s the moved away. The first Ancestral Peuebloans that lived in Mesa Verdewere known as Basketmakers, for their superb skill at the craft. They had begun to live off farming instead of hunting and gathering. There was a time that their population had multiplied, and houses had begun to be built above ground. After this occured, they had begun to be known as Publoans. Back to the former statement claimed, the Puebloans had begun to move from Mesa Verde, and go to the cliffs around the late 1200s. Nobody knows exactly why they had done that, but all that is known is that there was a drought towaards the end of the 1200s, and that they would not be able to do anymore farming. Nobdy will ever know the whole story and the Puebloans because most of what was important to them perished long ago. When the moved to the cliffs, they used them to their advantage, they had begun to make their homes under the overhanging cliffs. But they only lived there for around 100 years.               There are many stories to a submerged city, and about 40 years ago, it may have been found. The lost city of ATlantis was just a myth, but because of that myth many people kept searching the bottom of the oceanfloor for this grand city. It is believed that this city had been under water for about 5000 years, many experts say that in terms of size and wealth the amount is unforseable. There are other sunken cities around the world, but none seem to be as modern as this city, which is what makes it so unique. The reason that historians believe it was submerged 5000 years ago, is because some of the ceramics found dated back to the end of the stone age, this was over 1200 earlier than they had once thought. This city is very significant because as a submerged site, it had never been reoccupied, unless by fish. Many marine geologists still wonder why the city sank, and they are still trying to figure out why and how. It is a theory that the sea levels had changed, or ground subsidence, which could have had and outcome of a series of earthquakes or tsunami.                   There are many different reasons why archaeologists would be so interested in the past. All that we know is what they have figured out.

Thousands of years later, archaeologists are yet to discover several abandoned civilizations that lie all over the world. Every past or future ruin can teach incredible amounts of information to archaeologists. In the Inc-an civilization, bodies and artifacts were skillfully preserved, providing awaiting knowledge. Another civilization, the Pueblo-ans, are from thousands and thousands of years ago. The Pavlopetri show insight on the Earth's past geological structure. Whether it be satisfying curiosity, discovering the human roots, or tracing back past landscapes, ancient civilizations contain the necessary pieces to complete history's puzzle.        The Incas were helpful to have kept their civilization in such a condition that benefited archaeologists. Much of there clothing, bodies, and architecture was buries by vast snow up in the mountains. Their clothing speaks of past weather patterns and perhaps extinct animals. Their technology used to produce such may have been more advanced than others around the world. Their ruins inform archaeologists of neighboring regions that left behind nothing. Medical advancements can only be displayed in the form of performed bodies or documents. Their success attempts and past living population helps calculate the number of people today with Inc-an roots. In general, art tells us about their lifestyle; entertainment, responsibility, agriculture, etc. The study of their preserved culture fits the Spaniard and Inc-an puzzle pieces.        As with the Incas, the Pueblo-ans and Pavlopetri were vital to tracing back human roots and evolution. As these civilization began to break tradition and begin new, nomadic lifestyles, archaeologists can further understand the technology advancements of mankind. Rocks used for weapons and other household items hint towards common rock features of the past. The number of bodies and artifacts discovered help historians study the growth of the human population. However, most importantly, is what the Pavlopetri civilization was able to teach. Never had archaeologist been able to discover underwater civilizations, but they did. This drastically changed views of the changing water level in the world. Scientists were now able to study more geographical features and access the climate of the areas. Unlike the Incas, who provided a cultural view, the Pueblo-ans and Pavlopetri informed archeologists and geologists of past climate, weather, landscape, and rocks.        The puzzle is yet to be completed. Upon more advanced technology, the puzzle will continue to grow, as will our history. What will future civilizations think about today? What artifacts of ours will be used? The Incas, Pueblo-ans, and Pavlopetri preserved their culture and way of life for geologists and archaeologist to discover thousands of years later.

Learning about our origins and the places we come from is very important.  Many archeologists study past civilizations like the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.  When we study these civilizations we get to learn many about our past life.      Many artifacts found at these sites can tell us a lot about ways of life back then.  They can tell us whether ancient people had a religion or certain traditions.  The Inca's had a different life style.  They had a complex language and advanced agriculture.  Since the Inca's lived in the high Andes they had a different way of farming. The Inca's had a very interesting culture and the things we learn about it gives us an idea on how things advanced.      The Puebloans also had a unique culture.  The lived in small communities with elaborate buildings.  They did many things like hunting and making necessities like tools and home goods.  They lived in huts called pit-houses, which had the floor sunken in a few feet deep.  Because of there good works with their architecture they were called Basketmakers.  Like most ancient civilizations, the Puebloans had a religion.  They practiced their rituals in temples with chambers for certain things.  Many would go in certian rooms to pray for luck, healing, rain, or a good crop.  The Puebloans with their great architecture and ideas influenced many things from buildings to life skills.      Another important civilization was the Pavloperti.  They were believed to have come from the ancient myth of the sunken city of Atlantis.  Greek mythology says that there was a city that was consumed by the ocean.  Many people today are searching for an answer to see if this legend is true.  So far they have said that they think they might of found the ''lost city of Atlantis''.  Off the coast of Neapolis oceanologists have found ruins of what might be from the sunken city.  The Pavlopeti are believed to be the citizens of the ''sunken city''.      All of these civilizations may not seem that important. But once you discover the secrets and ancient stories you learn about how life was before our time.  Many artifacts show how much we've advanced in our technology and our cultures.   Learning about previous civilizations is very important for everybody to know about where they came from.

The discoveries involving the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri, have helped scientists understand more about the past. Artifacts, written languages, and textiles have provided us with knowledge about these ancient civilizations.? Archeologists keep careful records, and get as much information out of the evidence as they can.                                           The Inca of Peru had no form of writing, thus not allowing archeologists to study. By finding out clues from artifacts and their way of life, maybe the archeologists can piece the Inca life together. The Inca artifacts left behind might be objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or sliver, and may be found in buried graves for the dead. This allowed us to research the life style of the Inca.                          The Puebloans chose Masa Verde for their home in A.D. 550. Their skill at craft gave them the name, Bastketmakers. They learned to make pottery, and a more efficient way of hunting, the bow and arrow. Around A.D. 750, they began to build their houses above ground. These homes were build out of poles and mud, often with pit houses. They soon evolved into fifty rooms of stone masonry. The architecture was not the only thing changing. The pottery developed into more intrecut, black designs on a white background. Using the landscape, Puebloans built their dwellings beneath overhanging cliffs. They lived underneath the cliffs for less than one hundred years. They then left Masa Verde and traveled south, leaving their ancient civilization behind.                         The Puebloans society may have been abandoned, but a city has been sunken underwater for a some five thousand years. The secrets hidden in this lost city have inspired the myth of Atlantis.This city was found beneath southern Greece, covering at leas thirty thousand square meters of the ocean floor. The seabed held thousands of shards of pottery and a whole settlement of buildings, courtyards, streets, tombs, and religious structures were discovered.Many of these artifacts date back to the stone age. ''Atlantis was a myth but it is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going.''-Sakellariou                         The three civilizations have played an important role in keeping our history alive. It provided us with information on life in the past, letting us know what life was like. The ancient artifacts held within are the key to new explorations and discoveries.

Archeological Finds: Why So Important?          Throughout the years, people have been fascinated with ancient cultures. People dedicate their whole lives to learn about them. These people look for, and find, ancient sites in the most remote places and make important discoveries.         The ancient Inca people settled in the Andes mountains, it most of their history was recorded only orally, so historians weren't sure if they were true or not. According to Beth Gruber, 'The rest of our knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts.' These objects tell us how the Inca lived, what they believed, and how they survived. Without these important archeological finds, we may have only known what happened to the Inca by false tales.            Another ancient civilization, the Puebloans, strived in Mesa Verde. When scientists discovered the remains of their living arrangements and other buildings, they were amazed at their 'advanced...pole-and adobe construction [and] skillful stone masonry,' according to the National Parks Service. From these sites, archeologists were able to determine the Puebloans were skilled basket makers and potters. They dug up beautiful ceramics created by these ancient people and were amazed at their ability to make these amazing artworks. The Puebloans left no written records, but scientists were able to piece the puzzle together one step at a time, thanks to archaeological sites.              One of the most lasting of all Greek myths, the story of Atlantis has intrigued many. Therefore, archaeologists were delighted when a sparkling city was found underneath the waves of Greece. What they found amazed them. The city was much older then Plato's Atlantis myth! The city was extremely advanced for the time it was built, and made scientists reconsider the intelligence of ancient peoples. 'We found ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age.' says Dr. Jon Henson, co-director of the underwater survey. This suggests that the people of the past were much more advanced than historians originally believed. '...It represents a frozen moment of the past.' said Elias Spondylis, the other co-director of the survey.              Without the help of these archaeological finds, ancient peoples may have remained a mystery forever.

The Discoveries about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are important in helping people understand history from many years ago. The Inca were a civilization of people that lived about a hundred years ago. Puebloans were a group of people that moved to Mesa Verde long before the Europeans explored North America. The Pavlopetri was the name for the sunken city explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archeologists and marine geologist           Discovering the Inca society helped us learn about them more and about their way of life compared to ours. We know about them by artifacts that they left behind. The Inca lived high up in the Andes and may even have worshiped some mountains peaks. Inca lived high up in mountains some even lived in caves, and this helps to preserve sites because looters cant get to them because they are high up in the mountain. The Inca fell in in 1532 when the Spaniards murdered the last Inca king and took over the empire.           The Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about A.D. 550. They are known as basket makers for their skill to craft. Formerly nomadic they began to settle down and started farming which then they didn't have to gather and hunt. They lived in pit houses clustered into small villages sometimes built on mesa tops, but mostly on cliff recesses. The population had multiplied, and by about A.D. 750 they began making houses above ground with upright walls. By A.D. 1000 the people from Mesa Verde had advanced in their skill of construction. They began making more villages, but by A.D. 1200 the puebloans moved back into the cliffs we still don't know why but the archeologists are still looking for the answer.           The pavlopetri was a sunken settlement beneath the waters off southern Greece. This settlement dates back to 5,000 years to the time of homers hero. '...this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' said Dr. Jon Henderson. The theories made by marine geologists include sea level changes, ground subsidence as the result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. Some things that we have learned about the Incas are that the clues they left behind form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life. By studying these clues, archaeologists and others can piece together details of Inca life. The things you will learn will fascinate you.          Some of what we know from Inca history is from oral history. Europeans who arrived in their empire in 1532 described the Inca in their letters and diaries. The rest come from artifacts that could be made from gold, silver, or pottery even if they were buried for hundreds of years. Archaeologists who study these site keep careful records. Among the most important things to learn about a civilization are where it came from and what happened to it.            About 1,400 years ago, long before Europeans explored North America, a group of people living in the Four Corners region chose Mesa Verda for their home. For more than 700 years this civilization occurred and archaeologists have the artifacts to prove it. We have learned what kind of houses they had, what weapons they used, what they learned to make all from the stuff that people find.           Over the years civilizations begin to change and adopt to their surroundings. One example of this is the Puebloans who change their houses and their scenery. They made new houses that were more stable and livable. They went to the cliff dwellings and then they completely deserted it. Archaeologists are unsure as to why. We will never know the whole story, but we do know that they adopted to whats around them.           An incredible discovery that was made by archaeologists was a city that was submerged completely in water. It is off the coast of Neapolis. They have found ceramics that date back to the end of the stone age, which suggests that the settlement was occupied some 5,000 years ago, at least 1,200 years earlier than originally thought. The marine geologists have yet to work out why the settlement sank. Because of the conditions around it the city is basically a frozen moment of the past.            So as you can see history is very important to the modern world. In a very long time from now people will be learning about you in the same way. Clearly, people need to kno what happened years and years ago.

A lot of people question why history is so important. It happened, it's in the past, let's move on. But, really, history is extremely important to our future. The discoveries that have been made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because it shows us how ancient civilizations used to be.   From the Incas, we have learned how they kept their records, with knotted string. These knots of string were called quipus. Though, not many can read the colored string, we know that they were used to keep the calender and keep count of livestock. We have learned that many artifacts that have been found were buried with the deceased, these have provided the best idea of the life in Peru before and during the Inca rule. We have also learned how many of them died, due to preservation in the icy Andes. The bodies of the Inca were preserved in caves in cliff faces mainly, so looters could not get to them. The mountains, with their icy cold weather, can act as a freezer, leaving the bodies of the Inca in such good shape that experts may use modern medical scanning.   From the Puebloans, we have found how they lived in places called pithouses, a living room suck a few feet in the ground with four corner timbers supporting the roof. Later, around A.D. 750, the Puebloans began constructing houses above ground. The houses were built wall to wall in long, curving rows, often with a couple pithouses out front. The walls of the houses/buildings are known as the finest built in Mesa Verde because of the straight edges of the carefully shaped stones. For a time, the Puebloans were known as the Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Later on, pottery became more popular and baskets made a decline in quality. Mesa Verde had two major population shifts, one between A.D. 1100, and A.D. 1300, the other in A.D. 1200. The latter caused people to move back into cliff alcoves, though the sure reason is unknown.   The discoveries of the Pavlopetri are also significant. Evidence has been found on the 'oldest submerged town in the world,' and it's still the most well preserved. This town is expected to be the home of an elite, which raises the status of it exponentially. The submerged 'frozen moment of the past' has baffled archaeologists with how much information has been preserved. Only just recently have we been able to survey the ruins of the ancient city. Ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age suggests the settlement was occupied around 5,000 years ago. Many discoveries offer information about when the settlement was above water, and tells of possible other groups, for example, the Mycenaean Society. Not only is this underwater city an intrest because it reveals how people lived back then but it also intrigues natural scientists because the waters around it are so shallow. Also fascinating, this area predates Plato's writing of the sunken continent Atlantis.   In conclusion, all of these discoveries are extrememly important by telling us of the past. By learning from the past, people can predict more about the future. All of these ancient civilizations failed in some shape or form and we could avoid these same mistakes by studying them.

Why Ancient Civilization is so Important    By Emily Irvine        Ancient Civilizations are very important to us because they're the base of what we know now. They created our language and created our religion. Without ancient civilizations we might be the ones to have to create everything. I don't even know if we'd be living had it not been for ancient civilizations. In this article I'm going to be talking about 3 important ancient civilizations: the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.        Would you ever like to live on a mountain with a very cold climate? I didn't think so, but the Inca thought differently. The Inca lived in the mountains of the Andes, and that's how we know so much about them. The freezing weather has preserved artifacts and even bodies really well- so well that we can use modern medical scanners to learn how the people died or even how they lived. Some of what we know, though, has come from stories passed from generation to generation. Since they didn't have any archives or even an alphabet for that matter, historians don't really know much about their civilization except for what's in stories and what the artifacts show.        The Inca made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calendar to keep a count of livestock. But, now, nobody knows the Inca language so nobody knows what the knot means and nobody can read the stories tied into the colorful strings. Ince artifacts might be objects made from stone, gold, or silver. Some archaeologists have found artifacts in the ruins of buildings but, others were found buried in graves for the dead to use in the afterlife. That is important because it gives historians an insight on their religion, and what kind of lives the Inca might have lived to be able to make things out of gold and silver.        The Puebloans of Mesa Verde, were very good at basketmaking. They also replaced hunting and gathering with farming. This is very important because it tells us a little bit about how they lived, or what their lives were like. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops. Puebloans also learned to make pottery and they acquired the bow and arrow, which was a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. That is important because it shows that they don't spread out, and they were all just one big heard of people- they were nomadic afterall. Some historians might also find their pithouses important, because their was a hole for passage to the underworld called that 'sipapu.' That gives insight on their religion and on, once again, how they lived.        The findings of the Pavlopetri are very important. Geologists have found a megaron, which is a monumental strucure with a large rectangular hall, which means that the town might have been used by an elite. That tells us that the people who lived their were probably high status or were rich in some way. Geologists have found ceramics which dated back to the end of the stone age, and from that we can learn in what era these people lived.  That gives us an idea of how their life was like or how they lived.

The discoveries that archaeologists have made about the Inca, the Pueblians, and the Pavlopetri are so important because if they haven't made their discoveries we wouldn't be where we are today. The ancient civilization helped improve on how we live, starting with where is the right place to build your house. You couldn't just make a house where ever you want. You have to have the right level and far enough from water. if your hows was too close to the water your house would be flooded every time it rain. Us today didn't discover that. People in the ancient civilization discovered that. The Inca lived high in the Andes and worshiped some mountain peaks. Most of their sites are in remote high places. The Inca lived in high places because it was harder for enemies to get to their houses and attack their families.   On the other hand, the Pueblians were an amazing discovery. The Puebloans learned to make pottery and the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than a spear. The Puebloans made a house called the pithouses. The pithouses, people lived in pithouses from A.D. 550 to A.D 750. The living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof. There was a fire pit had an air deflector. The people of Mesa Verde had advanced from pole-and -adobe construction to skillful stone. The walls were thick, double-coursed stone often rose two or three stores high and were joined together into units of 50 rooms or more. Between A.D. 1100 and A.D. 1300, the population may have reached several thousands. ABout A.D. 1200, another major population came, and people begin to move back into the cliff alcoves that sheltered their ancestors centuries before. Archarologists still don't know why they moved, they thing it could of been for defense; or it was for religious or pshychological reasons; perhaps alcoves offered better protection from the elements.

The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important because without these discoveries we would not have been able find out so much about how the world got to where it is today, and how we can improve and what we can prevent our daily lives. This world is ancient, more so then human records can tell us about.  As such, several civilizations have existed that now are gone.  These civilizations had existed mostly without contact from other groups of people.  The rediscovery of these unfamiliar tribes had shaken the way that scientists think about the past.  The discoveries made about the Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have shown us the past itself.   From studying the Inca, archeologists have learned that they lived in different climates, from the desert to the jungle or mountains.  Scientists have found out that Incan tribes kept records with string, as they had no alphabet.  The archeologists who have studied the Inca have found out the Spanish conquerors killed the last king of the Inca's, leading to the destruction of the empire.  To the north of the Inca, the Puebloans had lived for nearly as long, and for hundreds of years before North America was colonized by Europe.   The discovery that the Puebloans had been living in the side of a cliff had shown scientists how people without the 'modern' knowledge had lived.  Based on what was left in the cliff dwellings, archeologists have made several discoveries.  One is that they both hunted farmed for their food.  The pottery depicted the everyday life ofthe Puebloan.  One last discovery was that the Puebloans moved several times in their history.  One century, they lived in undergound house, the next was above ground, a few centuries later they lived in a cliff.  The next civiliation has had a major relocation, more so then the Puebloans.   The discovery was a huge discovery for underwater explorers.  This sunken Greek town has given light to how the culture lived before there was knowledge of the Greece known today.  Pieces of pottery, tons of building and more have caught the eye of many explorers.  Scientists believe that a large earthquake or tsunami sunk and/or flooded the city.  The discovery of this city has gotten scientists thinking of cenarios of what happened.  Hopefully scientists will continue to explore and discover the past.

Have you ever wondered why we learn stuff about our history? We learn history for many different reasons. One of the main reasons is to learn what our ancestor did and use it in our daily lives. Some ancient civilizations that has made an impact in our lives are the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri. We learn what they have done and try to fix their way of living into our lives. During the time we try to discover these civilizations, we also need to edit what we do to handle the situation. Discoveries like these can help us determine our understanding and thinking of our ancestors.       Our ancestors have always had an reason in order to do something. For example, the Inca never really had a formal alphabet or system of writing, but instead they used knots to keep track of stuff. And still, they could run a big empire. But why knots? They could have used anything else but they chose knots as their communication. Also, how did they ever become a big empire without the use of words. If archaeologist had known the reason why our ancestors did this, we can use it to also have a big strong community or country. Another example are the Puebolans in Mesa Verde. They left for a strange reason in 1300 A.D. There are many theories why they left, like a drought and crop failures; but they have already survived many droughts. Maybe the soil depleted and they had to leave. Whatever the reason we can still learn from their mistake. If the soil had depleted, we can tell scientists to find ways for the soil we have now not to deplete too. We can prepare for a drought and crop failures. There is so many things to learn about our ancestors, but we can never learn it completely. Like for the discovery of the Pavlopetri. Though they made huge discoveries, archaeologists still haven't discovered even 1% of the ocean floor. Because of this, people are more eager to discover more about our world. To do that they need the technology. We now have scuba divers and submarine to explore the vast ocean. So as the demand for new discoveries increase, our technology will also dramatically increase. So curiosity has driven our world forward.       For now, we literally don't know anything about our ancestors. We can only guess what they did.  So, we need the technology so we can be most accurate as we can be in our theories. The discoveries we make can ultimately determines what our society will be like. If we had not even bothered in finding out about our ancestors, we wouldn't know a lot of our basic methods until we have to find the solution ourselves. So why are our discoveries of ancient civilization so important? It is because we can learn from them and use them in our daily life.

Many civilizations and all the walks of life has been introduced into our world as early as 550 A.D.           The first Ancestral Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde about that time. Their main craft was as basket makers. They started of nomadic, but as they grew and their culture matured they begin to lead a more settled life. A lot of  other things changed also including their means to get food. Farming replaced hunting and gathers their main source. They learned to make pottery and the bow an arrow replaced their signature tool of a spear thrower to hunt the atlatl. Most of their houses and living areas were found in cliff recesses, but sometimees mesa tops clustered with small pint house villages.       In times like these they lived a fairly prosperous and decent life as basket makers. Their population multiplied and their living resources expanded. They began building houses above ground with supported upright walls made out of poles and mud. the houses were built right next to each other. From here on these people are known as puebloans, a Spanish word meaning'village dwellers.'       As with and group or walk of like the only thing left to do was to succeed in more growth. Between A.D. 1100 and 1300 which was known as ' The Classic Period' the population increases to the thousands, and a more advanced home was created. It consisted of compact villages of many room, with the kivas built inside the enclosing walls instead of out in the open. The stone walls of the large pueblos are  regarded as some of the finest.       since the beginning of times we as a people have known what to do in order  to survive , what to in order for our world to become the great one that it is today. We have done nothing more than what we set out to do in ways that is good and others that are not. All we must do, out common goal as a people is to grow and prosper in life.

There have been many historical discoveries made in the ruins and areas of the acient Inca, Puebloans, and Greek. They have made dicoveries such as a system using rope to tell of history and dates, housing used by ancient civilizations, and even a lost city. These discoveries have been made by archaeologists traveling the world to find the artifacts needed.   While exploring the area where the ancient Inca lived, archaeologists discovered some amazing things. They discovered that since the Inca did not have a language or writing system, they made knots in colored strings to keep a count on livestock. The Inca also left behind clues as to how they lived. Textiles and clothing survived by being perserved in dry deserts and the cold mountains of the Andes. Even though some artifacts have been stolen by treasure hunters or looters, archaeologists still managed to find these clues to the ancient Inca.   The ancient Puebloans lived 1,400 years ago. They were mainly basketmakers. They lived in structures called pithouses. These structures had four corner timbers that supported the roof. They eventually advanced to skillful stone masonry instead of pole-and-adobe construction.   There have always been many cities n Greece, but when archaeologists dove under the surface of the water, they found something that no one had ever seen before. They discovered a lost city! This lost city was probably the exact city that inspired the Atlantis stories that people tell over and over again. The site of the city is about 30,000 square meters. It is located off the southern Peloponnese. Archaeologists believe it was consumed by the sea around 1000 BC. Marine archaeologists had to find help in technology to survey the city. This may be a huge discovery, but there is still about 99% of the ocean floor to explore.   Archaeologists traveling the world have found so many discoveries. They travel from the tips of the Andes to the bottom of the ocean floor. The clues that these civilizations left behind are going to be giving us glimpses into the past for years to come.

The Inca, Puebloans, and the lost city of Atlantis are all places that archeologists hunt for clues. Here they examine artifacts and/or ruins to find out how ancient civilizations lived.       The Inca was a Native American tribe that resided in the Andes mountains in South America. Archeologists have asked people with Inca blood to tell stories about their traditions. By doing this, they have learned a lot about the Inca's ways. Second, archeologists have examined ancient artifacts and belongings. This suggests that they can learn about what the Indians used as tools. Finally, archeologists use satellite imaging to look at ancient ruins. Like the Inca, the puebloans have some archeologists of their own.       The Puebloans lived in the Southwest in places called cliff dwellings. Cowboys first stumbled upon these ruins  in the late 19th century. The puebloans had ladders to reach their homes, which held a couple thousand residents. Pottery was also beautiful, with lots of drawings and decorative designs. The homes also had chimneys and air vents, which were very advanced at the time. In the next paragraph, archeologists may be on the brink of uncovering Atlantis.       Atlantis is a lost Greek city buried beneath the water. Taken by the sea in 1,000 BCE by an earthquake or tsunami, it is the oldest lost city in the ocean.  Archeologists flocked to the area when ruins were found by an oceanographer making depth charts. The tides, which caused sand to shift, revealed many artifacts and city ruins. There was even pottery which dated from 5000 BCE, a lot earlier than the archeologists thought. Today, the exploration is still going on, and there is a lot more to uncover.       The Inca, Puebloans, and Atlantis all keep archeologists busy. Whether it's exploring underwater temples, looking at graves, or exploring homes in cliffs, archeologists are digging more clues every day!

Clues left behind by the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri form an amazing portrait of their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.Without anyone who experienced these ancient civilizations, understanding them is like solving a mystery. However clues left behind allow archaeologist and others piece together details of ancient life.           Some of what we know about the Inca comes from oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation. We know some of the old stories because they were written down by the Europeans who arrived in the empire in 1532. They described the Inca in letters and diaries. The rest of the knowledge of the Inca comes from artifacts, or objects that they left behind, and from sites where artifacts are found. Inca artifacts include objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Some Inca textiles and clothing have also survived remarkably well. Archaeologists who study these sites keep careful records. They write down and photograph and artifacts they find, and note the exact position in which they find them. Sometimes archeology confirms historical record, only making fact, more true.           About 1,400 years ago, the Puebloans chose Mesa Verde as their home. They flourished here, and eventually built elaborate stone communities in the sheltered alcoves of the canyon walls. Then, in the late A.D. 1200s, they left their homes and moved away. Puebloans are known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. Farming replaced hunting and gathering as their main livelihood. They lived in pithouses clustered into small villages usually built on mesa tops but sometimes in cliff recesses. They learned to make pottery and acquired the bow and arrow, a more efficient weapon for hunting than the atlatl, a spear thrower. Archaeologists and others have been able identify all these attributes due to artifacts left behind and preserved.           About 5,000 years ago, a group of people know as the Pavlopetri strove. They lived in an area of about 30,000 square meters in southern Peloponnese. Today that sight has been found underwater, and has allowed marine geologists to study the ancient civilization.           Discoveries about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because it has allowed people to understand how civilization has evolved. Civilization started small, but grew and grew until what it is today. These ancient civilizations show that and tell a tale of how they lived.

Ancient Civilizations           The Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavolpetri are all ancient civilizations that   have helped shape our world today. They have given us insight on how certain myths and legends came to be, and they introduced many innovative inventions and customs into our world.       Every child has been told myths and legends before. Hercules, David and Goliath,    and another important one is the 'Lost City of Atlantis'! All these stories must come from somewhere and a team of Archeologists and Divers think they have uncovered the origin of this story. Explored by an Anglo-Greek team known as Pavlopetri, the sunken settlement is assumed to be dated back about 5000 years ago. in terms of size and wealth of detail is unprecedented, experts say. Dr Jon Henderson claims, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world,' whom is associate professor of underwater archaeology at the University of Nottingham. 'It has remains dating from 2800 to 1200 BC, which is odd because that dates back long before the illustrious days of classical Greece. The site straddles 30,000 square meters on the ocean floor just off the southern Peloponnese, archaeologists assume that the town was submerged around 1000 BC. It was not until this year that researchers have been able to study the town despite it being discovered some 40 years ago simply by chance by an Oceanographer.

Archaeologists have spent centuries trying to figure out lost civilizations. How they were formed, what it was like to live there. But one of the main questions is: What happened to it? The Incas, the Ancestral Puebloans, and the city of Atlantis (Pavlopetri) are a few of the lost civilizations that have yet to be fully discovered. The discoveries about the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very important.            The discoveries of these civilizations are important because it increases our knowledge of ancient history. The Incas where a civilization in Peru. They had no alphabet or system of writing, and they used strings to keep records. No one today knows what the knots mean, so we do not know what really happened. But, we do have clues. There is history passed down orally from generation to generation, and there are stories written down by the Europeans. The rest of our knowledge comes from artifacts, such as objects made of stone, pottery, gold, or silver. Inca textile and clothing has been preserved because of the deserts in Peru. These clues can help us compare the Spaniards' accounts of the Inca.            The discoveries of these civilizations are very important. Archaeologists have aqquired artifacts and information about these settlements, and are learning more and more about it everyday. There are some issues when it comes to searching for clues, like people stealing artifacts, weather conditions, and even geopgraphical conditions. In the future, we will probably discover more and more lost civilizations and will discover more and more about them.

But if we try to be smart, and look at the past, we can actually live for our full life.       Secondly, the Puebloans. They lived in a cliffside manner. This meant that they could be easy target, because they are already cornered. If you lived in a cliff, then you are impossible to sneak up on, but then you will be easily killed. This means that if we can find more strategic, safe places to dwell, then we will not be repeating history. Also, the Pavlopetri are a good example of geographical placement. If they had been higher up, they would have a city full of people and a bunch of descendants. Lost Civilizations   By Abhijith Badarinath               The lost civilizations of the Incas, the Puebloans and also the city of Atlantis has been found. Many archaeologists have found them. But even trying to find them has taken them years and years of hard work. These are extremely major findings in archaeological history.       Lets start out with the Inca tribe. This was tribe that lived near the Andes mountain range. There was lost until about 6 years ago in 2007, the ruins hold great mysteries. The ruins have been sculpted so finely. These Incas were masters of building and architecture.       Now to the Puebloans. Puebloans created the first pit houses. These houses were rather small in today's world, but back then they were huge for their standards. The Kivas were at least four times bigger than the pit houses.       Greeks made a huge archaeological discovery as well. Apparently off the coast of Southern Greece, there appears to be a sunken civilization. As said by Doctor Jon Henderson, 'There is now no doubt that this is the oldest submerged town in the world'. There were ceramics dating back to the stone age. This is probably where the myth of Atlantis came from.   Well, that myth is now officially one hundred percent true. There is more to be found down in the city of Atlantis.       In conclusion, the lost civilizations are not lost anymore. There are major findings in human history. All this came from years and years of hard work. These lost civilizations will never be lost again.

The discoveries made about the Incas, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important because we can learn about what the area is like and what types of useful resources could be in the area. There will be some things that we will probably never understand about these ancient civilizations and so much we could learn.

We can see if they lived differently than us or if they lived about the same. They all lived in different places, but they all lived way back then and had to survive the same way.       The ancient Inca of Peru are hard to study because they left no archives for historians to study because they had no writing system or alphabet. They lived up in the Andes where it is really cold, but they managed to live. They also had a huge empire using strings to keep records. Their civilization lived for nearly a hundred years, but later was taken over my Spaniards.       The Puebloans were people who made it on terrible land, but were the best basketweavers and house builders of their time. They learned how to plant and grow food, and they invented the bow and arrow, and easier way to hunt than the throwing spear. They had to figure out how to live on such bad land and they lived there for about 800 years. No one knows why they moved, but they think that the land was probably stripped of all the nutrients and they just deserted the area.       The Pavlopetri were the people who lived in the unknown underwater world called Atlantis. Archaeologists studied the settlement where they found new buildings and ceramics dating back to the end of the stone age. Atlantis is still a mystery and we need to still study to learn more about this mysterious underwater place.       The discovery of these people are very important because we are learning more about how the people used to live. We are still studying the sites and their settlements and trying to figure out more. But now we can see how they lived compared to how we live today. The archaeologists are doing the best they can and as fast as they can so that we can learn more about these people and how they survived and what happened to their settlements or empires. This is why the discovery of the Inca, Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are so important to us.

Why are the findings of ancient civilizations, such as the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetry that were once alive, so important?  The discoveries made from these once-empires are crucial for many reasons. By studying these civilizations, archeaoligists have figured out where many things we do originate from, how the different lifestyles differ from our own, and how these civilizations coped with life.               The discoveries of the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetry have helped scientists to know exactly where things came from.  It is important we know this type of information because we can see the changes that were made. Everyday activities such as hunting with spears have evolved drastically and we are able to connect these two.               How these civilizations coped with life, may help us learn how to deal with certain things we have difficulty with. Houses and shelters had a specific structure to deal with things, like heat, rain, cold, and critters. By lthe discoveries made, we are able to intergrate them into our everyday lives.                  Each empire had a different lifestyles. By learning about this, we learn how they differed from ours. Because of the location of their homelands, many important inventions were made. Today many of our modern day technology is based off of this.                   The discoveries made from the Inca, the Puebloans and the Pavlopetry are important. They give us ideas on how to improve our everyday society and to not make the same mistakes they may have commited.

The Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have all contributed to modern archaeology and history in some shape or form. The Incans left behind the massive ruins of their civilization, the Puebloans left behind their small villages upon cliffs, and the Pavlopetri discovered the ancient Greek settlement entombed in water. The Incan civilization possesed no kind of writing system, but instead, a complex form of communication through an object called, a 'Quipu'. These were strings ordered in special fashion, and were basically a way of conveying a message without speaking.       Today, many archaeologists understand more about the Incans not only because of the Quipu, but becuase of the many ruins they left behind, an example the kingdom of Cuzco. The Puebloans left behind many small ruins of villages. Formally a nomadic people, they began to settel on cliffsides and hills. They learned how to create pottery sculptures, and they learned how to efficeintly utilize the bow and arrow, so that they would be able to hunt and kill their prey much easier. The Puebloans resided in the area of 'Mesa Verde', spanish for 'green table'. They were also skillful basketweavers. And third, the ancient sunken settlement off the coast of Greece. These ruins reveal to modern day citizens the elaborate architecture and the vast number of people the ancient Greek possesed. The settlement, now completely sumberged underwater, may have very well inspired the legend of Atlantis. This ancient settlement is nearly 5,000 years old, and has been well preserved under the water.

People lived in pithouses from about A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 , as settled agriculture began . The pihouse feautured a living room sunk a few feet in the ground. Four corner timbers supported the roof . Pithouses later evolved into kivas

The idea of advanced civilizations being lost in time is a very fascinating one to humans. When we think of a lost civilization, we think of the Lost City of Atlantis, the mythical city that was sucked under the ocean in 'The Odyssey ' by Homer, a Greek philosopher. This is not always the case.           Let's take the Inca empire of Peru. They had no sort of alphabet or writing system.  They used colored and knotted string to keep records of goings on in their Empire. In fact, the first Europeans to meet the Inca were astounded that they could run an Empire rivaling the Roman empire just through knotted pieces of string. However, not much is known about the Inca empire. They left behind no archives or writings for historians to study. But, we mad with what we had. Clues left behind by the Inca put together a puzzle revealing the complex art, history and culture behind this great empire.           Atlantis was a city in the Greek 'Odyssey' that was swallowed by the ocean in one night. Now scientists believe it wasn't solely myth. A team of divers has discovered an underwater settlement that dates back 5000 years, back to the times of the Greek empire. The size and wealth of this city was supposedly phenomenal. 'There is no doubt that this is the largest submerged city in the world' said Doctor Jon Henderson, professor of underwater archaeology at the University of NoNottingham. It's oldest remains date back to 2800 to 1200 B.C, Long before the days of classical Greece. There are, however, older sunken sites, but none can be matched to a planned city such as this one.            An idea of lost civilizations filled with ancient undiscovered technology has excited humans since the first reading of the Odyssey. However, not all lost cities are as exciting as Atlantis. And not all can be found.

The inca

The discoveries between the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri civilizations are important in knowledge of the world's history. If we don't learn about our past and history, then we are either bound to repeat it, or if we went through an economic crisis, we wouldn't know how to restart or where to begin. By researching the ways of life of these different cultures helps our knowledge and understanding of survival and how civilizations came to be. My theory is that there are still thousands of civilizations that we still know nothing about. The Inca were a great civilization. Clues left behind from the Inca helped to form a better understanding of how they lived, such as religion, art, architecture, agriculture, government, and transportation. Little of what we know about the Inca comes from stories passed down through the centuries, but some of the information given were from the Spaniards, who did not speak the Inca language well, so it is not a completely reliable source. Some of what we know are from letters and diaries from the Spaniards, describing what they were like. Most of our knowledge, however, comes from ancient artifacts, like objects made from stone, pottery, gold, or silver, which last a long time, even if they had been buried. Some clothing and textiles have been surprisingly preserved over time, mostly because of the dry desert environment. One of the main reasons that their civilization had been preserved so well was from their location. The Inca lived in the Andes, and many of their sites are in high locations that are hard to get to. The cold mountains acted as a freezer to Inca bodies, making it easier for experts to examine and learn about how they lived, the health conditions they had, and maybe even how they died. It is hard to tell some details, however, because of their location being hard to reach. The Mesa Verde National Park preserves an immense amount of reminders from this ancient civilization. At one point, archeologists called these people Anasazi, meaning 'the ancient ones' or 'ancient enemies,' but we now call them Ancestral Puebloans. The first Puebloans settled in Mesa Verde at about 550 A.D. They led a more settled way of life, like farming instead of hunting and gathering. They lived in built pithouses built on mesa tops or in cliff recesses. They learned pottery and acquired the bow and arrow. They were known as Basketmakers for their skill at the craft. They were fairly prosperous, and population multiplied. At about 750 A.D. they began building houses above the ground with upright wals made of poles and mud. Population continued to grow, and so did their technology and knowledge. Eventually, fires were built for cooking, houses became more comfortable, but they realized their living conditions were unsatisfactory, and around 1300 A.D., Mesa Verde was deserted. The last civilization is one that had been named a myth for thousands of years-- the sunken city of Atlantis. After researching the abandoned city on the ocean floor, archeologists found several clues preserved from the shifting sands in the ocean. The city had been planned out; a world of buildings, courtyards, streets, tombs and religious structure, along with many shards of pottery. Marine geologists still have yet to find out why the civilizations sand, and theories include many sea leven changes, ground subsidence as a result of earthquakes, or a tsunami. Less than 1% of the world's ocean floors have been discovereed, and there may still be a lot more down there that is waiting to be found.

Many years ago there were many ancient civilizations.  Only their writings, tools, and buildings remain today.  Their achievements captivate people to this day.  Three of these ancient civilizations stand out from the others.  They are the Incas, Puebloans, and the lost city of the Greeks.           The first is the ancient Inca of Peru.  The Incas were a great people with an empire that rivaled the expanse of ancient Rome.  Archaeologists have discovered amazing clues left behind like their religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and way of life.  They were able to thrive in their unforgiving land.  These artifacts left behind are amazing because are the only things that are left of the once great empire that rivaled the Romans.           The second in the Ancestral Puebloans.  They were once a nomadic people who made great baskets, but traded that life for a one of farming and permanent settlements built on high place like a mesa.  Their population prospered, so at about A.D.750 they began to build houses with upright walls made of pole and mud.  Between A.D 1100 and A.D. 1300 their population reached the thousands.  They built compact villages to house the growing population.  These buildings were carefully crafted with well cut stones.  In A.D 1200 another population shift occurred.  They moved back to the cliffs for unknown reasons like maybe the alcoves provide better protection from elements, religious reasons, or even psychological reasons.  Whatever the reason it gave rise to the cliff dwellings for which Mesa Verde is most famous.  This is important discovery because the shows a group of people who were once excellent basket makers and became a great group of people who lived on high mesas and alcoves.            The third is the lost Greek city.  This ancient city is covered with great amount of ocean water.  This might of been the city that inspired the myth about Atlantis.  It is not the oldest town, but it was the first to be planed.  The underwater city holds great submerged buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs and religious structures.  In addition, the seabed was replete with thousands of shards of pottery. This is an amazing discovery because less than 1% of the ocean floor has been surveyed.  This find was like finding a needle in a hay stack.  Also, the relics are in good condition and haven't have been looted.  This just adds to the great find.           These three ancient civilizations are important discoveries because they give great glimpses of the past.  These discoveries could lead to an idea or invention that that we could only dream of.  The people may not be alive any more, but their items from their daily lives on and serve a reminder of those whose time has passed on this Earth.

The discoveries made about the Inca, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri are very significant in the world of archaeology. These civilizations have provided new knowledge to archaeologists about their rich culture and history.       In the article, 'Ancient Inca: Archaeology Unlocks the Secrets of the Past', written by Beth Gruber, Gruber exposes how the Incas are a very mysterious civilization that archaeologists yet have much knowledge about. The Inca 'made knots in colored strings called quipus to record the calender to keep count of livestock'. These colorful artifacts are of no meaning to archaeologists. They have no clue about it, but these knots yield the answers to all of the Inca's history because the quipu was their only form of records. The Inca history archaeologists know about comes from 'oral history, or stories passed from generation to generation'. This means that the Inca remain mysterious to this day. The human race may never find out the Inca's culture. Yet, the desire for knowledge keeps archaeologists searching for more Incan artifacts.       In the article, 'Mesa Verde National Park Ancestral Puebloans and their World', it is revealed to the reader that the Puebloans are very significant at keeping archaeologists doing their job. The Puebloans built 'stone walls of large pueblos that are regarded as the finest built in Mesa Verde'. The Puebloans must have been very creative people because their constructing methods are elegant. Archaeologists have discovered their beautiful building and have learned that they are great builders from just looking and examining their architecture. The Puebloans later 'traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona, settling among their kin who were already there'. The Puebloans remain one of the most fascinationg civiliations ever to have lived, and having living descendants of them today gives archaeologists a huge help in finding out more about this unique ancient civilization.       In the article 'Lost Greek city that may have inspred Atlantis myth gives up secrets', by Helena Smith in Athens, Smith describes how the Pavlopetri might have been the people living in the famed 'Lost City of Atlantis'. This lost city found beneath the waters off of Greece may have inspire that infamous myth. Even if this city is not the genuine Atlantis, it still remains 'the oldest submerged town in the world'. This city, doubtless of being Atlantis, is still a huge archaeology discovery. This city provides new information about what kind of culture the Pavlopetri people had. In addition, this city may be the city of Atlantis, but regardless of that, Atlantis 'is a myth that keeps underwater exploration going'. Whether or not this city is Atlantis, the town just pushes underwater archaeologists to push harder to try and find more artifacts and more knowledge. To find out that a myth truly is real by using hard facts would be amazing. It would feed some of the human desire to gain more and more knowledge. The Pavlopetri people, having have lived in Atlantis or not, have provided a huge find for archaeologists everyewhere.       The ancient Inca, Puebloans, and Pavlopetri have given archaologists around the world so much to study and so much more knowledge. These ancient civilizations have given the us their rich culture and history to examine, and the human race is both grateful and thankful for the huge amount of knowledge that they have recieved about these mysterious people.

Why are the discoveries of ancient civilizations so important? The discoveries found from ancient civilizations are important, they are important  because we can use them to understand the past, and how much we have advanced in technology today. Some ancient artifacts that help us understand the past of ancient civilizations include the quipu from the Inca empire, the pit houses from the Puebloans, and lost sunken Greek city believed to be Athens.         Quipu used in the Inca civilization helps us today understand how the Incans kept track of numbers without an established number or writing system. The quipu was a long colorful string attached to a stick with knots in it. Each knot was used to keep track of anything from money, to food, to cattle.         Pit houses from the Mesa Verde community were being occupied by Puebloans from the year A.D. 550 to A.D. 750 when people began to ditch hunting and gathering to a settled farming community. The pit houses were held up by timbers in each of the four corners of the structure. The pit house also contained a living room which was sunken in a few feet from the ground. A fire pit was also included in the pit house and had an air shaft to release smoke from the fire.         The sunken city in Greece, believed to be Athens, tells modern day archeologist and scientist much about the ancient civilization. Since it was so well preserved by the sand in the bay, Anglo-Greek scientist can survey through to find main streets, buildings courtyards, and even religious structures. This sunken city helps us today by showing us how technologically advanced the ancient Greeks were.         Quipus, pit houses, and sunken cities all are important to the discovery of our past. All of these artifacts help us conclude information to the development of our ancestors in the advancing civilizations they called home.

The discoveries of the ancient civilizations of the Inca, the Mesa Verde  Puebloeans, and the discovery of the city of Atlantis. The ancient Inca civilization was a very important discovery because we could see how advanced they were during their time compared to the other civilizations. Incas have taught us by leaving artifacts behind that they showed us what games they played and what kind of tools they used to cook and the weapons they used to hunt with. They also showed us how they kept records with quipos. The Inca left many clues behind including religion, art and architecture, agriculture, government, transportation, and a unique way of life. The bodies scientist find can tell how they died because the bodies are in good shape which allow scientist to use modern medical scanning equipment.                 The Mesa Verde Puebleans are another ancient civilization that we have discovered. The Mesa Verde people lived long before explored North America. The Mesa Verde people lived and flourished here and built elaborate stone communities.First Puebloans were known as basket-makers for their skill in craft. Farming began to replace their nomadic way of hunting and gathering food. They lived in small villages made of clustered pit houses. Pit houses were like tents only made of wood and had four support timbers that held the whole thing up. The pit houses later in time evolved and became known as kivas. By A.D. 750 they began to build houses above the ground. These houses had upright walls made of poles and mud. The houses were built right next to each other in long curving rows. The Mesa Verde people, due to their new housing methods, started to be known as Puebloans.                    The ancient underwater city of Atlantis was a huge discovery to  all the people around the world. Some of the remains found were dated long before the glory, golden age, days of Greece. The famous city takes as much as 30,000 square meters of the ocean floor off the southern Peloponnese. It is believed that the city was consumed by the sea around 1,000 BC. Atlantis was found with buildings, courtyards, main streets, rock-cut tombs, and religious structures. The sunken city of Atlantis dates as far back as Homer's heroes and as far as to when Plato wrote his allegorical tale of the sunken continent of Atlantis. Experts say that the knowing of size and wealth of detail is unprecedent. The city of Atlantis also provides potential insights to the workings of a Mycenaean society. That is why the discoveries of the ancient Inca society, the Mesa Verde Puebloans, and the discovery of the ancient myth of the sunken underwater city of Atlantis were a great discovery and influenced us in many ways. The Incas left behind their quipos as calenders, the Mesa Verde Puebloans left the houses they built above ground that sound a lot like an apartment complex, and the underwater society of Atlantis left their buildings and many other important artifacts to show us how advanced they were during and before their time before being underwater.

Did you know that there is an entire city underwater, and dozens of artifacts buried under layers of sediment? All this precious history is preserved by nature. In this article I will be telling you about the well preserved artifacts that were left by the Incas, the Puebloans, and the Pavlopetri.       First, the Incan empire ruled from 1438-1532. Although some Incan tablets have been looted, we still have learned a great deal about the Incan life from other Incan tablets. From these tablets we have learned that the Inca lived high in the Andes mountains, and that they may have worshiped some mountains.  We have also learned that the Inca sometimes buried tablets with the dead. Although the Incan ruins had many records looted, they wrote such thorough that we still learned a lot about their lives.       Secondly, the Puebloans ruled from 550-1200 a.d.. They ruled for over 700 years. The Puebloans lived in Mesa Verda, in North America. From records, we learned that they Puebloans created the bow and arrow, and pithouses. The bow and arrow was a weapon, this  weapon was a long piece of wood that had a string that ran from the top to the bottom of the wood. Pithouses were created when the Puebloans settled. These were holes dug a few feet into the ground with four corners of wood that provided shelter. Altogether, the Puebloans were people that adapted quickly to their envirement.       Third, the lost city, also known as Atlantis, ruled from 2800-1200 BC. This city is located 30,000 square meters away from Southern Peloponnese. This lost city was preserved by shifting sands. These shifting sands covered up the city, therefore preserving it. Some believe that Plato, a very famous Greek writer, wrote about this city in his tale called'The sunken continent of Atlantis.' We will never really know if his writing was based off of this lost city. Furthermore, this lost city has been one very big mystery.       Lastly, these empires and cities have left many written records. Through these records, we have been able to see through the eyes of the people of the past.

Archaeology Helps Discover Lost Civilizations                                      Many historians  have contributed to discovering and studying objects obtained from areas where ancient civilizations once prospered.This practice is called Archaeology.Archaeology has led to the discovery of several lost civilizations.                In ancient Inca of Peru, archaeologists discovered that the people did not have a written record system during this time period. Instead, the people of Inca made knots in colored string called Quipus to record dates and to keep track of the amount of livestock.They also discovered stories written by Spanish soldiers and priests telling about the Inca when they arrived at the empire in 1532. However, most Spaniards didn't speak the Inca language and could have misunderstood the culture.Most of what archaeologists learn from the lost civilization of Inca is from the artifacts discovered .Some of these artifacts include, clothing, pottery, building ruins, bodies, and weapons.Bodies have been found in the Andes mountains and are in such good condition they can be studied with modern medical equipment to show how they died and how they lived.                Another society archaeology helped us discover was the ancestral Puebloans. They lived in Mesa Verde,Mexico(now a national park).Archaeologists discovered remains from homes that were called pithouses, these houses consisted of a living room sunk a few feet in the ground and four corner timbers supporting the roof.People lived in these houses until A.D. 550 to A.D. 750.The people who lived during this time are referred to as Basketmakers for their skill in weaving baskets . In the year A.D. 1000, people's homes had evolved from pole supported homes to walls of stone holding fifty or so rooms.The populations continued to grow and in some of the artifacts observed from this time a noticeable decline in quality is seen. The people appeared to be moving into cliff alcoves that had previously sheltered their ancestors. These people became known as the cliff dwellers. They built their homes under overhanging cliffs with sandstone shaped into rectangle blocks.However, ancestral Pueblans only lived in the cliffs for less than a hundred years.Several theories were made about their migration. For example, crop failures, drought,or land resource depletion may have caused the people to migrate. Studies from archaeologists have shown when the cliff dwellers left they traveled south into New Mexico and Arizona.               Archaeologists have also discovered a submerged city that was  off the southern coast of Greece. This lost city  could have inspired one of the world's most legendary myths,the fable of Atlantis. The sunken settlement was explored by an Anglo-Greek team of archaeologists .They discovered the settlement was as old as 5,000 years to the time of Homer's heroes.The site covers 30,000 square meter of the ocean floor and is believed to be consumed by the sea around 1000 BC.Arcaeologists  have studied building structures, pottery, rock-cut tombs, and religious a monuments. By finding the lost city Arcaeologists have allowed historians to discover how many people lived in this time and what their religious beliefs were.They  also can use this information to compare modern day lifestyles to the ones our ancestors lived by before.                As you can see, Archaeologist work has allowed the world to discover and better understand how different our lives are from lost ancient civilizations.
